parameter.name: defaultQueueUrl
parameter.description: This value is used when you do not set queue url on the operation level. If you do not specify the queue url here or on the operation level the exception is thrown. A queue URL is constructed in the following format: https://sqs.{REGION}.amazonaws.com/{ACCOUNT_NUMBER}/{QUEUE_NAME} Example: https://sqs.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/123456789101/test-queue

parameter.name: waitTime
parameter.description:
Default value for the maximum duration of a single poll, in seconds:
  • Set this field to a value between `1` and `20` to use long polling. With long polling, if there are messages available immediately, the connector returns the query results immediately. If not, the connector waits up to the specified amount of seconds for a message to be added before returning an empty response.
  • Set this field to `0` to use short polling. With short polling, the connector always returns the query results as soon as possible, even if that means returning an empty response.

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: testQueueArn
parameter.description:
This parameter is used to test connection to SQS connector. If you do not specify this parameter the test connection is not performed. A queue ARN is constructed in the following format: arn:aws:{REGION}:{ACCOUNT_NUMBER}:{QUEUE_NAME}
Example: arn:aws:sqs:us-east-1:123456789101:test-queue

parameter.name: sessionToken
parameter.description: The session token provided by Amazon STS.

parameter.name: accessKey
parameter.description: The access key provided by Amazon.

parameter.name: secretKey
parameter.description: The secret key provided by Amazon.

parameter.name: tryDefaultAWSCredentialsProviderChain
parameter.description: Set this field to true to obtain credentials from the AWS environment, See: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-java/v2/developer-guide/credentials.html

parameter.name: region
parameter.description: Set the topic region endpoint

parameter.name: customSqsEndpoint
parameter.description: Sets a custom SQS endpoint. Useful when a non-standard service endpoint is required, such as a VPC endpoint.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) when initially establishing a connection before the connector gives up and times out. A value of 0 means infinity and is not recommended.

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: Time unit used in the connection timeout configurations.

parameter.name: maxConnections
parameter.description: Sets the maximum number of allowed open HTTP connections.

parameter.name: socketTimeout
parameter.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) for data to be transferred over an established, open connection before the connection times out. A value of 0 means infinity and is not recommended.

parameter.name: socketTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: Time unit used in the socket timeout configurations.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: proxyHost
parameter.description: The optional proxy host.

parameter.name: proxyPort
parameter.description: The optional proxy port.

parameter.name: proxyUsername
parameter.description: The optional proxy username.

parameter.name: proxyPassword
parameter.description: The optional proxy password.

parameter.name: proxyDomain
parameter.description: The optional proxy domain.

parameter.name: proxyWorkstation
parameter.description: The optional proxy workstation.

parameter.name: testQueueArn
parameter.description:
This parameter is used to test connection to SQS connector. If you do not specify this parameter the test connection is not performed. A queue ARN is constructed in the following format: arn:aws:{REGION}:{ACCOUNT_NUMBER}:{QUEUE_NAME}
Example: arn:aws:sqs:us-east-1:123456789101:test-queue

parameter.name: roleARN
parameter.description: The Role ARN unique identifies role to assume in order to gain cross account access.

parameter.name: customStsEndpoint
parameter.description: Sets a custom STS endpoint. Useful when a non-standard service endpoint is required, such as a VPC endpoint.

parameter.name: accessKey
parameter.description: The access key provided by Amazon.

parameter.name: secretKey
parameter.description: The secret key provided by Amazon.

parameter.name: tryDefaultAWSCredentialsProviderChain
parameter.description: Set this field to true to obtain credentials from the AWS environment, See: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-java/v2/developer-guide/credentials.html

parameter.name: region
parameter.description: Set the topic region endpoint

parameter.name: customSqsEndpoint
parameter.description: Sets a custom SQS endpoint. Useful when a non-standard service endpoint is required, such as a VPC endpoint.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) when initially establishing a connection before the connector gives up and times out. A value of 0 means infinity and is not recommended.

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: Time unit used in the connection timeout configurations.

parameter.name: maxConnections
parameter.description: Sets the maximum number of allowed open HTTP connections.

parameter.name: socketTimeout
parameter.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) for data to be transferred over an established, open connection before the connection times out. A value of 0 means infinity and is not recommended.

parameter.name: socketTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: Time unit used in the socket timeout configurations.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: proxyHost
parameter.description: The optional proxy host.

parameter.description: The optional proxy port.

parameter.name: proxyUsername
parameter.description: The optional proxy username.

operation.name: addPermission
operation.description: This operation adds a permission to a message queue.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: Name for this permission

parameter.name: accountIds
parameter.description: IDs of the AWS accounts to share this queue with

parameter.name: actions
parameter.description: List to indicate how much to share (SendMessage, ReceiveMessage, ChangeMessageVisibility, DeleteMessage, GetQueueAttributes)

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: Permissions will be added to the queue represented by this URL. This parameter is optional, and if you do not specify queueUrl, you must specify the default global queue URL at the configuration level.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: changeMessageVisibility
operation.description: This operation changes the visibility timeout of a specified message in a queue to a new value, not to exceed 12 hours.

parameter.name: receiptHandle
parameter.description: Receipt handle associated with the message whose visibility timeout must change

parameter.name: visibilityTimeout
parameter.description: New value of the message visibility timeout (up to 4300 seconds or 12 hours)

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the Amazon SQS queue to act on. This parameter is optional, and if you do not specify queueUrl, you must specify the Default Global Queue URL at the configuration level.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: changeMessageVisibilityBatch
operation.description: This operation changes the visibility timeout of up to 10 ChangeMessageVisibility requests, with each result reported individually in the response.

parameter.name: receiptHandles
parameter.description: List of receipt handles of the messages for which the visibility timeout must be changed

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the Amazon SQS queue to act on. This parameter is optional, and if you do not specify queueUrl, you must specify the Default Global Queue URL at the configuration level.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createQueue
operation.description:
This operation creates a new queue, or returns the URL of an existing one.

Queue Attributes

Name Type Description Default Value
All All values.
DelaySeconds Number The length of time, in seconds, for which the delivery of all messages in the queue is delayed. Valid values: An integer from 0 to 900 seconds (15 minutes). 0
MaximumMessageSize Number NuThe limit of how many bytes a message can contain before Amazon SQS rejects it. Valid values: An integer from 1,024 bytes (1 KiB) to 262,144 bytes (256 KiB). 262,144 (256 KiB)
MessageRetentionPeriod Number NumbThe length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS retains a message. Valid values: An integer from 60 seconds (1 minute) to 1,209,600 seconds (14 days) 345,600 (4 days)
Policy String The queue's policy. A valid AWS policy.
ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds Number The length of time, in seconds, for which a ReceiveMessage action waits for a message to arrive. Valid values: An integer from 0 to 20 (seconds) 0
RedrivePolicy String The string that includes the parameters for the dead-letter queue functionality of the source queue as a JSON object.
VisibilityTimeout Number The visibility timeout for the queue, in seconds. Valid values: An integer from 0 to 43,200 (12 hours). 30
KmsMasterKeyId String The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SQS or a custom CMK.
KmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds Number The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling AWS KMS again. An integer representing seconds, between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 86,400 seconds (24 hours). 300 (5 minutes).
FifoQueue Boolean Designates a queue as FIFO. Valid values: true, false. If you don't specify the FifoQueue attribute, Amazon SQS creates a standard queue. You can provide this attribute only during queue creation. You can't change it for an existing queue. When you set this attribute, you must also provide the MessageGroupId for your messages explicitly.
ContentBasedDeduplication Boolean Enables content-based deduplication. Valid values: true, false. Every message must have a unique MessageDeduplicationId.
ApproximateNumberOfMessages Number The approximate number of messages available for retrieval from the queue.
ApproximateNumberOfMessagesDelayed Number The approximate number of messages in the queue that are delayed and not available for reading immediately. This can happen when the queue is configured as a delay queue or when a message has been sent with a delay parameter.
ApproximateNumberOfMessagesNotVisible Number The approximate number of messages that are in flight. Messages are considered to be in flight if they have been sent to a client but have not yet been deleted or have not yet reached the end of their visibility window.
CreatedTimestamp Number The time when the queue was created in seconds
LastModifiedTimestamp Number The time when the queue was last changed in seconds
QueueArn String The Amazon resource name (ARN) of the queue

Redrive Policy

Name Type Description Default Value
deadLetterTargetArn String The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dead-letter queue to which Amazon SQS moves messages after the value of maxReceiveCount is exceeded.
maxReceiveCount Number The number of times a message is delivered to the source queue before being moved to the dead-letter queue. When the ReceiveCount for a message exceeds the maxReceiveCount for a queue, Amazon SQS moves the message to the dead-letter-queue.

parameter.name: queueName
parameter.description: Name of the queue to be created

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: A map of attributes with their corresponding values. (See the table above)

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteMessage
operation.description: This operation deletes the message identified by the message object in the queue.

parameter.name: receiptHandle
parameter.description: Receipt handle of the message to be deleted

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the queue to delete messages from. This parameter is optional and if you do not specify queueUrl you need to set in the configuration level Default Global Queue URL.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteMessageBatch
operation.description: This operation deletes up to 10 messages from the specified queue. This is a batch version of DeleteMessage.

parameter.name: entries
parameter.description: List of receipt handles for the messages to be deleted

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the queue to delete messages as a batch from. This parameter is optional and if you do not specify queueUrl you need to set in the configuration level Default Global Queue URL.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteQueue
operation.description: This operation deletes the message queue represented by this object and can even delete a non-empty queue. Because deleting a queue can take up to 60 seconds, wait at least that long before you create a new queue with the same name.

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the queue to delete. This parameter is optional and if you do not specify queueUrl you need to set in the configuration level Default Global Queue URL.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getApproximateNumberOfMessages
operation.description: This operation retrieves an approximate number of visible messages for a queue.

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the queue.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getQueueAttributes
operation.description: This operation shows queue attributes to expose the underlying functionality.

parameter.name: attributeNames
parameter.description: List of attribute retrieve information for

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the Amazon SQS queue to take action on This parameter is optional and if you do not specify queueUrl you need to set in the configuration level Default Global Queue URL.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getQueueUrl
operation.description: This operation returns the URL of an existing queue.

parameter.name: queueName
parameter.description: Name of the queue whose URL must be fetched

parameter.name: queueOwnerAWSAccountId
parameter.description: AWS account ID of the owner that created the queue

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listDeadLetterSourceQueues
operation.description: This operation returns a list of the queues that have the RedrivePolicy queue attribute configured with a dead-letter queue.

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: Queue URL of a dead-letter queue. This parameter is optional and if you do not specify queueUrl you need to set in the configuration level Default Global Queue URL.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listQueues
operation.description: This operation returns a list of your queues. The maximum number of queues that can be returned is 1000.

parameter.name: queueNamePrefix
parameter.description: String to use for filtering the list results. Only those queues whose name begins with the specified string are returned.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: purgeQueue
operation.description: This operation deletes the messages in a queue specified by the queue URL.

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: Queue URL where messages are to be fetched from. This parameter is optional and if you do not specify queueUrl you need to set in the configuration level Default Global Queue URL.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: read
operation.description: This operation reads a number of messages from a queue.

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the queue.

parameter.name: waitTime
parameter.description:
Maximum duration of a single poll, in seconds.
  • Set this field to a value between `1` and `20` to use long polling. With long polling, if there are messages available immediately, the connector returns the query results immediately. If not, the connector waits up to the specified amount of seconds for a message to be added before returning an empty response.
  • Set this field to `0` to use short polling. With short polling, the connector always returns the query results as soon as possible, even if that means returning an empty response.

parameter.name: maxNumberOfMessages
parameter.description: Maximum number of messages to read

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.description: Name for the permission to be removed

parameter.name: queueUrl

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy

operation.description: This operation sends a message to a specified queue. The message must be between 1 and 256K bytes long.

parameter.description: Message to send

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: Queue where the message is to be sent.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: sendMessageBatch
operation.description: This operation delivers up to 10 messages to the specified queue. This is a batch version of SendMessage.

parameter.name: messages
parameter.description: List of SendMessageBatchRequestEntry items

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: Queue where the message is to be sent.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: setQueueAttributes
operation.description: This operation sets the value of one or more queue attributes, which can take up to 60 seconds to propagate throughout the SQS system (although changes made to the MessageRetentionPeriod attribute can take up to 15 minutes).

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: Map of attributes to set

parameter.name: queueUrl
parameter.description: URL of the queue.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: waitTime
parameter.description:
Maximum duration of a single poll, in seconds.
  • Set this field to a value between `1` and `20` to use long polling. With long polling, if there are messages available immediately, the connector returns the query results immediately. If not, the connector waits up to the specified amount of seconds for a message to be added before returning an empty response.
  • Set this field to `0` to use short polling. With short polling, the connector always returns the query results as soon as possible, even if that means returning an empty response.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors
